title: Developing rirods
text: contribute rirods fork source files : https://github.com/irods/irods_client_library_rirods, make Pull Request.

title: Developing rirods
text: following R packages furthermore required development: xml2, jsonlite, readr, testthat (>= 3.0.0), knitr, rmarkdown, spelling, httptest2. convenience, one can also use renv () renv::restore() install dependencies. usethis devtools packages suggestions streamline development. See devtools usethis common development tasks setups covered packages. Development rirods relies httptest2 enables testing logic R side API without requiring access remote service. recording API response mock files. mock files stored several directories tests/testthat/.

title: Developing rirods
text: unit test included source files can either run local remote iRODS C++ REST API service, version 0.9.3 later - https://github.com/irods/irods_client_rest_cpp.

title: Developing rirods
text: Launch local demonstration iRODS service (including REST API): Alternatively, one can use R function use_irods_demo(). Note, options can used Docker Docker-compose plugin installed. result demonstration REST API running http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3 (later version). configuration R needed development (except removing possible mock files). example, run unit tests local server use: devtools::test(). miscellaneous development tasks one can, furthermore, use: local_create_irods(). test fixture almost exported function create_irods() except uses alternative directory working directory thereby preventing cluttering package source files (defaults temporary directory). working directory can restored package directory restarting R session (possibly CTRL + SHIFT + F10) running withr::deferred_run().
code: # clone the repository (and submodule "irods_demo") # or use `git submodule update --init` when already cloned without submodules git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/irods/irods_demo # start the REST API cd irods_demo docker-compose up -d nginx-reverse-proxy

title: Developing rirods
text: Testing remote server requires specification server information. information needs entered .Rprofile file: server information stored environmental variables DEV_HOST_IRODS ,DEV_ZONE_PATH_IRODS, DEV_USER, DEV_PASS. Server information provided scrambled format prevent leakage sensitive information GitHub. following step needed scramble information. Generate package development key: Store package development key environmental variable user level. convenience one can use usethis::edit_r_environ() opens .Renviron file. Enter key replacing <key> follows: Scramble iRODS server information httr2::secret_encrypt(). example, scramble host name follows: Store scrambled information designated places project level .Rprofile: host name DEV_HOST_IRODS, zone path DEV_ZONE_PATH_IRODS (e.g., "/tempZone/home"), user name DEV_USER, password DEV_PASS. Restart R sessions (possibly CTRL + SHIFT + F10). Note unit tests built clean server one user (.e., DEV_USER).
code: # dependency management options(renv.settings.snapshot.type = "explicit") source("renv/activate.R")  # development key (create key with httr2::secret_make_key() and place in user # level environment variables. One can use usethis::edit_r_environ() for this. # Store the key under "DEV_KEY_IRODS")  # iRODS environment variables for development Sys.setenv(DEV_HOST_IRODS = "nLO8T0IpHCT2kXklYE-IB0HjYpNkg5wN4ZKk7TPSvkwGf9FauDR-O5mVI-mmD2_zNFGLoaVcAgYl") Sys.setenv(DEV_ZONE_PATH_IRODS = "gunp5Ts08NHfpKAdbFCBuilVb7Wjnxojbt7bA1e-9Q") Sys.setenv(DEV_USER = "ZGlORquE2G6BIPS5JAcuPcngmBB6Wg") Sys.setenv(DEV_PASS = "ZGlORquE2G6BIPS5JAcuPcngmBB6Wg") httr2::secret_make_key() DEV_KEY_IRODS="<key>" httr2::secret_encrypt("http://myserver/irods-rest/0.9.3" ,"DEV_KEY_IRODS")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: rirods package R client iRODS.

title: R Client for iRODS
text: can install development version rirods like : , development version GitHub, like :
code: install.packages("rirods") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("irods/irods_client_library_rirods")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: package connects iRODS C++ REST API - https://github.com/irods/irods_client_rest_cpp. Launch local demonstration iRODS service (including REST API): result demonstration REST API running http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3 (later version). Docker containers designed easily stand DEMONSTRATION iRODS server. intended education exploration. USE PRODUCTION
code: # load library(rirods) # setup a mock iRODS server (https://github.com/irods/irods_demo) use_irods_demo("alice", "passWORD")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: connect REST API endpoint choice, load rirods, connect create_irods(), authenticate iRODS credentials:
code: # connect create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: example Alice user iRODS can authenticate iauth(). prompts dialog can enter username password without hardcoding information scripts.
code: # login as alice with password "passWORD" iauth() # or iauth("alice", "passWORD")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: Suppose Alice like upload R object current R session iRODS collection. , use isaveRDS() command:
code: # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # check where we are in the iRODS namespace ipwd() #> [1] "/tempZone/home/alice"  # store data in iRODS isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: truly appreciate strength iRODS, can add metadata describes data object “foo”:
code: # add some metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",    "data_object",    operations =      data.frame(operation = "add", attribute = "foo", value = "bar", units = "baz") )  # check if file is stored with associated metadata ils(metadata = TRUE) #>  #> ======== #> metadata #> ======== #> /tempZone/home/alice/foo.rds : #>  attribute value units #>        foo   bar   baz #>  #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path        type #>  /tempZone/home/alice/foo.rds data_object

title: R Client for iRODS
text: Alice wanted copy foo R object iRODS collection current R session, use ireadRDS():
code: # retrieve in native R format ireadRDS("foo.rds") #>   x y #> 1 1 x #> 2 8 y #> 3 9 z

title: R Client for iRODS
text: Possibly Alice want native R object stored iRODS file type can accessed programs. , use iput() command: Later somebody else might want download file store locally:
code: library(readr)  # creates a csv file of foo write_csv(foo, "foo.csv")  # send file iput("foo.csv")  # check whether it is stored ils() #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path        type #>  /tempZone/home/alice/foo.csv data_object #>  /tempZone/home/alice/foo.rds data_object # retrieve it again later iget("foo.csv") read_csv("foo.csv") #> Rows: 3 Columns: 2 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (1): y #> dbl (1): x #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>       x y     #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 x     #> 2     8 y     #> 3     9 z

title: R Client for iRODS
text: adding metadata others can easily discover data future projects. Objects can searched General Queries iquery():
code: # look for objects in the home collection with a wildcard `%` iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME WHERE COLL_NAME LIKE '/tempZone/home/%'") #>      [,1]                   [,2]      #> [1,] "/tempZone/home/alice" "foo.csv" #> [2,] "/tempZone/home/alice" "foo.rds" # or for data objects with a name that starts with "foo" iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME WHERE DATA_NAME LIKE 'foo%'") #>      [,1]                   [,2]      #> [1,] "/tempZone/home/alice" "foo.csv" #> [2,] "/tempZone/home/alice" "foo.rds"

title: R Client for iRODS
text: Finally, can clean Alice’s home collection:
code: # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) irm("foo.csv", force = TRUE)  # check if objects are removed ils() #> This collection does not contain any objects or collections. # close the server stop_irods_demo() # optionally remove the Docker images # irods:::remove_docker_images()

what: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
text: Coerce iRODS Zone information class data.frame().

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
code: # S3 method for irods_df as.data.frame(x, ...)

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
text: x irods_df class object. ... Currently implemented

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
text: Returns data.frame. Note, columns metadata consists list data frames, status_information permission_information consist data frames.

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # store data in iRODS isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # add some metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",   "data_object",   operations =     data.frame(operation = "add", attribute = "foo", value = "bar",       units = "baz") ) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # iRODS Zone with metadata irods_zone <- ils(metadata = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # check class class(irods_zone) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'irods_zone' not found  # coerce into `data.frame` and extract metadata of "foo.rds" irods_zone <- as.data.frame(irods_zone) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'irods_zone' not found irods_zone[basename(irods_zone$logical_path) == "foo.rds", "metadata"] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'irods_zone' not found  # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
text: create iRODS configuration file containing information iRODS server. file created, future sessions connect iRODS server without intervention.

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
code: create_irods(host, zone_path, overwrite = FALSE)  remove_irods()

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
text: host URL host. zone_path Path zone iRODS server (e.g., "/tempZone/home"). overwrite Overwrite existing iRODS configuration file. Defaults FALSE.

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
text: Invisibly, path iRODS project file.

what: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
text: Note function can used admin rights.

title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
code: iadmin(   action,   target,   arg2 = character(1),   arg3 = character(1),   arg4 = character(1),   arg5 = character(1),   arg6 = character(1),   arg7 = character(1),   verbose = FALSE )

title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
text: action action: add, modify, remove. target subject action: user, zone, resource, childtoresc, arg2 arg2 arg3 arg3 arg4 arg4 arg5 arg5 arg6 arg6 arg7 arg7 verbose Show information http request response. Defaults FALSE.

title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
text: Invisible http status.

title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authentication iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # add user iadmin(action = "add", target = "user", arg2 = "Bob", arg3 = "rodsuser") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # add user password iadmin(action = "modify", target = "user", arg2 = "Bob", arg3 = "password",   arg4 = "pass") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # delete user iadmin(action = "remove", target = "user", arg2 = "Bob") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

what: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
text: Provides authentication service iRODS zone. Using function without arguments results prompt asking user name password thereby preventing hard-coding sensitive information scripts.

title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
code: iauth(user = NULL, password = NULL, role = "rodsuser")

title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
text: user iRODS user name (prompts user user name supplied). password iRODS password (prompts user password supplied). role iRODS role user (defaults "rodsuser").

title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
text: Invisibly NULL.

title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

what: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
text: ipwd() icd() iRODS equivalents getwd() setwd() respectively. example, whereas getwd() returns current working directory local system, ipwd() returns current working directory iRODS.

title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
code: icd(dir)  ipwd()

title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
text: dir Collection set working directory.

title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
text: Invisibly current directory change (convention setwd()).

title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # default dir icd(".") #> Error in eval(quote(current_dir), .rirods): object 'current_dir' not found ipwd() #> NULL  # relative paths work as well icd("/tempZone/home") #> Error in eval(quote(current_dir), .rirods): object 'current_dir' not found ipwd() #> NULL  # go back on level lower icd("..") #> Error in eval(quote(current_dir), .rirods): object 'current_dir' not found ipwd() #> NULL  # absolute paths work as well icd("/tempZone/home/rods") #> Error in eval(quote(current_dir), .rirods): object 'current_dir' not found ipwd() #> NULL  # back home icd("/tempZone/home") #> Error in eval(quote(current_dir), .rirods): object 'current_dir' not found  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

what: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
text: Transfer file iRODS local storage iget() read R object RDS file iRODS ireadRDS() (see readRDS()).

title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
code: iget(   logical_path,   local_path = basename(logical_path),   offset = 0,   count = 2000L,   verbose = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE )  ireadRDS(   logical_path,   offset = 0,   count = 2000L,   verbose = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
text: logical_path Source path iRODS. local_path Destination path local storage. default, basename logical path; file stored current directory (see getwd()). offset Offset bytes data object. Defaults 0. count Maximum number bytes write. Defaults 2000. verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE. overwrite Whether local file overwritten exists. Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
text: R object case ireadRDS(), invisibly NULL case iget().

title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # \dontshow{ .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) # } # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # save the iris dataset as csv and send the file to iRODS write.csv(iris, "iris.csv") iput("iris.csv") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # bring the file back with a different name iget("iris.csv", "newer_iris.csv") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS. file.exists("newer_iris.csv") # check that it has been transferred #> [1] TRUE  # send an R object to iRODS in RDS format isaveRDS(iris, "irids_in_rds.rds") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # read it back iris_again <- ireadRDS("irids_in_rds.rds") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS. iris_again #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'iris_again' not found  # delete objects in iRODS irm("irids_in_rds.rds", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS. irm("iris.csv", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()  # \dontshow{ setwd(.old_wd) # }

what: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
text: List contents collection, optionally stat, metadata, /access control information element collection.

title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
code: ils(   logical_path = ".",   stat = FALSE,   permissions = FALSE,   metadata = FALSE,   offset = 0,   limit = 100,   message = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
text: logical_path Path collection whose contents listed. default current working collection (see ipwd()). stat Whether stat information included. Defaults FALSE. permissions Whether access control information included. Defaults FALSE. metadata Whether metadata information included. Defaults FALSE. offset Number records skip pagination. Defaults 0. limit Number records show per page. Defaults 100. message Whether message printed collection empty. Defaults TRUE. verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE.

title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
text: Dataframe logical paths , requested, additional information.

title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # list home directory ils() #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # make collection imkdir("some_collection") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # list a different directory ils("/tempZone/home/rods/some_collection") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # show metadata ils(metadata = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # delete `some_collection` irm("some_collection", force = TRUE, recursive = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
text: iRODS, metadata stored attribute-value-units triples (AVUs), consisting attribute name, attribute value optional unit. function allows chain several operations ('add' 'remove') linked specific AVUs. Read metadata looking iCommands equivalent imeta iRODS Docs.

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
code: imeta(   logical_path,   entity_type = c("data_object", "collection", "user"),   operations = list(),   verbose = FALSE )

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
text: logical_path Path data object collection (name user). entity_type Type item add metadata remove . Options 'data_object', 'collection' 'user'. operations List named lists data.frame representing operations. valid components lists vectors : operation, values 'add' 'remove', depending whether AVU added removed metadata item (required). attribute, name AVU (required). value, value AVU (required). units, unit AVU (optional). verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE.

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
text: Invisibly, HTTP response.

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
text: https://docs.irods.org/master/icommands/metadata/

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authentication iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # store isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # check if file is stored ils() #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # add some metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",   "data_object",    operations =     list(      list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo", value = "bar", units = "baz")    ) ) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # `operations` can contain multiple tags supplied as a `data.frame` imeta(   "foo.rds",   "data_object",   operations = data.frame(     operation = c("add", "add"),     attribute = c("foo2", "foo3"),     value = c("bar2", "bar3"),     units = c("baz2", "baz3")    )  ) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # or again as a list of lists imeta(   "foo.rds",   "data_object",   operations = list(     list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo4", value = "bar4", units = "baz4"),     list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo5", value = "bar5", units = "baz5")   ) ) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # list of lists are useful as AVUs don't have to contain units imeta(   "foo.rds",   "data_object",   operations = list(     list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo6", value = "bar6"),     list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo7", value = "bar7", units = "baz7")   ) ) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # check if file is stored with associated metadata ils(metadata = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

what: Create a New Collection in iRODS — imkdir
title: Create a New Collection in iRODS — imkdir
text: equivalent dir.create(), creating collection iRODS instead local directory.

title: Create a New Collection in iRODS — imkdir
code: imkdir(logical_path, create_parent_collections = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Create a New Collection in iRODS — imkdir
text: logical_path Path collection create, relative current working directory (see ipwd()). create_parent_collections Whether parent collections created necessary. Defaults FALSE. verbose Whether information HTTP request response printed. Defaults FALSE.

title: Create a New Collection in iRODS — imkdir
text: Invisibly HTTP request.

title: Create a New Collection in iRODS — imkdir
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authentication iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # list all object and collection in the current collection of iRODS ils() #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # create a new collection imkdir("new_collection") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # check if it is there ils() #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # and move to the new directory icd("new_collection") #> Error in eval(quote(current_dir), .rirods): object 'current_dir' not found  # remove collection icd("..") #> Error in eval(quote(current_dir), .rirods): object 'current_dir' not found irm("new_collection", force = TRUE, recursive = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

what: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
text: Store object file iRODS. iput() used transfer file local storage iRODS; isaveRDS() saves R object current environment iRODS RDS format (see saveRDS()).

title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
code: iput(   local_path,   logical_path = basename(local_path),   offset = 0,   count = 2000L,   truncate = "true",   verbose = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE )  isaveRDS(   x,   logical_path,   offset = 0,   count = 2000L,   truncate = "true",   verbose = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
text: local_path Local path file sent iRODS. logical_path Destination path iRODS. default, basename local_path used file stored current working directory (see ipwd()). offset Offset bytes data object. Defaults 0. count Maximum number bytes write. Defaults 2000. truncate Whether truncate object opening . Defaults TRUE. verbose Whether print information HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE. overwrite Whether file iRODS overwritten exists. Defaults FALSE. x R object save iRODS.

title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
text: (Invisibly) HTTP response.

title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # \dontshow{ .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) # } # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # save the iris dataset as csv and send the file to iRODS write.csv(iris, "iris.csv") iput("iris.csv") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # save with a different name iput("iris.csv", "iris_in_irods.csv") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS. ils() #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # send an R object to iRODS in RDS format isaveRDS(iris, "iris_in_rds.rds") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # delete objects in iRODS irm("iris_in_irods.csv", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS. irm("iris_in_rds.rds", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS. irm("iris.csv", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()  # \dontshow{ setwd(.old_wd) # }

what: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
text: Use SQL-like expressions query data objects collections based different properties. Read queries looking iCommands equivalent iquest iRODS Docs.

title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
code: iquery(   query,   limit = 100,   offset = 0,   type = c("general", "specific"),   case_sensitive = TRUE,   distinct = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
text: query GeneralQuery searching iCAT database. limit Maximum number rows return. Defaults 100. offset Number rows skip paging. Defaults 0. type Type query: 'general' (default) 'specific'. case_sensitive Whether string matching query case sensitive. Defaults TRUE. distinct Whether distinct rows listed. Defaults TRUE. verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE.

title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
text: Invisibly, HTTP response.

Please use `create_irods()`.  # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # store isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # add metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",   "data_object",   operations =     list(       list(operation = "add", attribute = "bar", value = "baz")   ) ) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # search for objects by metadata iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME WHERE META_DATA_ATTR_NAME LIKE 'bar%'") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

what: Remove Data Objects or Collections in iRODS — irm
title: Remove Data Objects or Collections in iRODS — irm
text: equivalent file.remove(), applied item inside iRODS.

title: Remove Data Objects or Collections in iRODS — irm
code: irm(logical_path, force = TRUE, recursive = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Remove Data Objects or Collections in iRODS — irm
text: logical_path Path data object collection remove. force Whether data object collection deleted permanently. FALSE, sent trash collection. Defaults TRUE. recursive collection provided, whether contents also removed. collection empty recursive FALSE, deleted. Defaults FALSE. verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE.

title: Remove Data Objects or Collections in iRODS — irm
text: Invisibly HTTP call.

title: Print Method for iRODS Data Frame Class. — print.irods_df
text: x object class irods_df. ... optional arguments print methods. digits minimum number significant digits used: see     print.default. quote logical, indicating whether entries     printed surrounding quotes. right logical, indicating whether strings     right-aligned.  default right-alignment. row.names logical (character vector), indicating whether (    ) row names printed. max numeric NULL, specifying maximal number     entries printed.  default, NULL,     getOption("max.print") used.

code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo()  # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost/irods-rest/0.9.3", "/tempZone/home") #> Warning: cannot create dir '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot create file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Warning: cannot open file '/home/runner/.config/R/rirods/config.irods': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, ifelse(append, "a", "w")): cannot open the connection  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods") #> Error: Can't find iRODS configuration file. Please use `create_irods()`.  # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # store data in iRODS isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds") #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # add some metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",   "data_object",   operations =    data.frame(operation = "add", attribute = "foo", value = "bar",      units = "baz") ) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # iRODS Zone with metadata irods_zone <- ils(metadata = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # print (default no row.names) print(irods_zone) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'irods_zone' not found  # with row.names print(irods_zone, row.names = TRUE) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'irods_zone' not found  # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) #> Error: Not connected to iRODS.  # remove iRODS configuration remove_irods()

code: use_irods_demo(   user = character(),   pass = character(),   recreate = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )  stop_irods_demo()

title: Run Docker iRODS Demonstration Service — use_irods_demo
text: user Character vector user name (defaults "rods" admin) pass Character vector password (defaults "rods" admin password) recreate Boolean indicate whether recreate (reboot) iRODS demo server (defaults FALSE). Recreating destroy content current instance. verbose Verbosity (defaults TRUE).

title: Run Docker iRODS Demonstration Service — use_irods_demo
text: Invisible

title: Run Docker iRODS Demonstration Service — use_irods_demo

title: Run Docker iRODS Demonstration Service — use_irods_demo
text: https://github.com/irods/irods_demo

title: Run Docker iRODS Demonstration Service — use_irods_demo
code: if (interactive()) {    # launch docker irods_demo containers (and possibly download images) with   # default credentials   use_irods_demo()    # same but then with "alice" as user and "PASSword" as password   use_irods_demo("alice", "PASSword")    # stop containers   stop_irods_demo() }
